episode_title: 109 - The One Where Underdog Gets Away

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is confronting her boss, Terry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Terry, I, I, I know that I haven’t worked here very long, but I was wondering, do you think it would be possible if I got a $100 advance in my salary?

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: An advance?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s so that I can spend Thanksgiving with my family. See, every year we go skiing in Vail, and normally my father pays for my ticket, but I sort of started the whole independence thing, you know, which is actually why I took this job.

content.speaker: Terry
content.text: Rachel, Rachel, sweetheart. You’re a terrible, terrible waitress. Really, really awful.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I, I hear what you’re sayin’. I’m with you. Um, but I, but I’m trying really hard. And I think I’m doing better. I really do. Does anybody need coffee? (everyone in the place raises their hand) Oh, look at that.

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is approaching a customer.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me, sir. Hi, you come in here all time. I was just wondering, do you think there’s a possibility that you could give me an advance on my tips?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, ok, that’s fine. Fine. Hey, I’m sorry about that spill before. (picks up the tip he leaves) Only $98.50 to go.
(Monica enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey. Ross, did you know Mom and Dad are going to Puerto Rico for Thanksgiving?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, they’re not.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes, they are. The Blymens invited them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re wrong.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I am not wrong.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re wrong.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I just talked to them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m calling Mom.
(Joey enters. His face looks abnormally colorful.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And this from the cry-for-help department. Are you wearing makeup?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, I am. As of today, I am officially Joey Tribbiani, actor slash model.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s so funny, ’cause I was thinking you look more like Joey Tribbiani, man slash woman.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What were you modeling for?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know those posters for the city free clinic?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, wow, so you’re gonna be one of those “healthy, healthy, healthy guys”?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You know, the asthma guy was really cute.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you know which one you’re gonna be?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, but I hear lyme disease is open, so… (crosses fingers)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good luck, man. I hope you get it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks.
(Ross comes back to the couch.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you were right. How can they do this to us, huh? It’s Thanksgiving.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, I’ll tell you what. How about I cook dinner at my place? I’ll make it just like Mom’s.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Will you make the mashed potatoes with the lumps?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, they’re not actually supposed to have… (Ross looks at her sheepishly) I’ll work on the lumps. Joey, you’re going home, right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And I assume, Chandler, you are still boycotting all the pilgrim holidays.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, every single one of them.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you’re gonna be with your grandma?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, and her boyfriend. But we’re celebrating Thanksgiving in December ’cause he is lunar.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So you’re free Thursday, then.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Oh, can I come?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah. Rach, are you thinking you’re gonna make it to Vail?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Absolutely. Shoop, shoop, shoop. Only a hundred and two dollars to go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I thought it was $98.50.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well it was. I, I broke a cup.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I’m off to Carol’s.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, ooh! Why don’t we invite her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ooh, ooh. Because she’s my ex-wife, and will probably want to bring her, ooh, ooh, lesbian life partner.

content.description: Carol and Susan’s apartment, Susan is there. Ross enters.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, is uh, is Carol here?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: No, she’s at a faculty meeting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I uh, just came by to pick up my skull. Well, not mine, but…

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Come in.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. Yeah, Carol borrowed it for a class, and I have to get it back to the museum.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What’s it look like?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Kinda like a big face without skin.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yes, I’m familiar with the concept. We can just look for it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok. (browsing the apartment) Wow, you guys sure have a lot of books about bein’ a lesbian.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Well, you know, you have to take a course. Otherwise, they don’t let you do it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, Yertle the Turtle. A classic.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Actually, I’m reading it to the baby.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The uh, the baby that hasn’t been born yet? Wouldn’t that mean you’re… crazy?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: What, you don’t think they can hear sounds in there?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re not serious, I mean, you really… you really talk to it?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yeah, all the time. I want the baby to know my voice.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you uh, do you talk about me?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Yeah, yeah, all the time.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: But um, we just refer to you as Bobo the Sperm Guy.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there but Rachel.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, if she’s talking to it, I just think that I should get some belly time too. Not that I believe any of this.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I believe it. I think the baby can totally hear everything. I can show you. Look, this will seem a little weird, but you put your head inside this turkey, and then we’ll all talk, and you’ll hear everything we say.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d just like to say that I’m totally behind this experiment. In fact, I’d very much like to butter your head.
(Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, Rach, did you make your money?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, not even close. Forget Vail, forget seeing my family, forget shoop, shoop, shoop.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rach, here’s your mail.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks, you can just put it on the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, here’s your mail.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks, you can just put it on the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you just open it?
(Rachel opens it. Inside is the money she needed.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god, oh, you guys are great.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We all chipped in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We did?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You owe me 20 bucks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. Thank you so much!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler, here you go, got your traditional Thanksgiving feast, you got your tomato soup, your grilled cheese fixin’s, and your family size bag of Funyuns.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, wait, Chandler, this is what you’re havin’ for Thanksgiving dinner? What, what, what is it with you and this holiday?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, I’m nine years old.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I hate this story.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We just finished this magnificent Thanksgiving dinner. I have—and I remember this part vividly—a mouthful of pumpkin pie, and this is the moment my parents choose to tell me they’re getting divorced.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes. It’s very difficult to appreciate a Thanksgiving dinner once you’ve seen it in reverse.

content.description: The subway, Joey spots a gorgeous woman waiting. He goes up to her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, hi. We uh, we used to work together.

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: We did?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, at Macy’s. You were the Obsession girl, right? I was the Aramis guy. (pretends to spray cologne) Aramis? Aramis?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Yeah, right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I gotta tell you. You’re the best in the business.

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Get out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m serious. You’re amazing. You know when to spritz, when to lay back.

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Really? You don’t know what that means to me.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, you smell great tonight. What’re you wearing?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Nothing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, uh, you wanna go get a drink or something?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Yeah. (she gets up, notices something behind Joey) Oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: I just remembered, I have to do something.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. What?

content.speaker: Girl
content.text: Um, leave.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait, wait, wait!

(Joey turns around and sees his face on a poster in the subway. The poster says: What Mario isn’t telling you…V.D., you never know who might have it. A variety of scenes are shown with the poster displayed all over New York City.)

content.description: Central Perk, Joey enters, amongst snickers from the gang.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I guess you all saw it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Saw what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, we were just laughing. You know, how laughter can be infectious.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey enters, upset.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Set another place for Thanksgiving. My entire family thinks I have VD.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tonight, on a very special Blossom.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is cooking Thanksgiving dinner. Chandler is standing in the doorway, not wanting to participate in the festivities.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mmm, looking good. Ok, cider’s mulling, turkey’s turking, yams are yamming. (notices Ross is depressed) What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know. It’s just not the same without Mom in the kitchen.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, that’s it. You know what? Just get out of my way and stop moping.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s closer.
(Rachel enters, excited.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I got the tickets! I got the tickets! Five hours from now, shoop, shoop, shoop.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, you must stop shooping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, I’m gonna get my stuff.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, will you just come in already?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, I prefer to keep a safe distance from all this merriment.
(Phoebe takes a slice of pumpkin pie and waves it in front of Chandler’s face.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look out, incoming pumpkin pie!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, we all laughed when you did it with the stuffing, but that’s not funny anymore.
(Chandler leaves.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Monica, I got a question. I don’t see any tater tots.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not a question.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But my mom always makes them. It’s like a tradition. You get a little piece of turkey on your fork, a little cranberry sauce, and a tot! It’s bad enough I can’t be with my family because of my disease.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, fine. Tonight’s potatoes will be both mashed with lumps, and in the form of tots.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, I’m off to talk to my unborn child.
(Ross grabs for some food, Monica slaps his hand away.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, Mom never hit.
(Ross exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, all done.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What, Phoebe, did you whip the potatoes? Ross needs lumps!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry, oh, I just, I thought we could have them whipped and then add some peas and onions.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would we do that?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, ’cause then they’d be like my mom used to make them, you know, before she died.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, three kinds of potatoes coming up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, good-bye you guys. Thanks for everything. (she starts to leave, and hits everyone with her skis) Oh, sorry! Oh, sorry!
(Chandler enters, running.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The most unbelievable thing has happened. Underdog has just gotten away.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The balloon?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, the actual cartoon character. Of course the balloon. It’s all over the news. Right before he reached Macy’s , he broke free and was spotted flying over Washington Square Park. I’m goin’ to the roof, who’s with me?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t, I gotta go.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Come on. An 80-foot inflatable dog let loose over the city. How often does that happen?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Almost never.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Got the keys? or Got the keys!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok.
(Everyone leaves the apartment.)

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, Ross is preparing to talk to her belly.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Anytime you’re ready.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, ok, here we go. (he crouches down near her stomach) Ok, where am I talking to, here? I mean, uh, well, there is one way that seems to offer a certain acoustical advantage, but…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Just aim for the bump.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok, ok, ok, ok, here goes. You know, I, you know, can’t do this. Uh, this is too weird. I feel stupid.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: So don’t do it, it’s fine. You don’t have to do it just because Susan does it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hello, baby. Hello, hello.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the group is coming back from the roof.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I loved the moment when you first saw the giant dog shadow all over the park.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, but did they have to shoot him down? I mean, that was just mean.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, right about now the turkey should be crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside. Why are we standing here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’re waiting for you to open the door. You got the keys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No I don’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, you do. When we left, you said, “got the keys.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No I didn’t. I asked, “got the ke-eys?”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, no, you said, “got the keys”.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do either of you have the keys?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The oven is on.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I gotta get my ticket!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait, wait, we have a copy of your key.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well then get it, get it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That tone will not make me go any faster.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That one will.
(Joey leaves to get the copy of the key.)

content.description: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is reading, Ross is talking to her stomach.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And everyone’s telling me, you gotta pick a major, you gotta pick a major. So, on a dare, I picked paleontology. And you have no idea what I’m saying, because, let’s face it, you’re a fetus. You’re just happy you don’t have gills anymore.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Look, you don’t have to talk to it. You can sing to it if you want.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, please. I am not singing to your stomach, ok?
(Susan enters.)

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Hi, how’s it goin?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shh! (singing) Here we come, walkin’ down the street, get the funniest looks from, everyone we meet. Hey, hey ! (to Carol) Hey, uh, did you just feel that?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I did.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Does it always, uh—?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: No, no that was the first.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Keep singing! Keep singing!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, you’re my baby, and I can’t wait to meet you. When you come out I’ll buy you a bagel, and then we’ll go to the zoo .

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: I felt it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, hey, I’m your daddy. I’m the one without any breasts .

content.description: The Hallway, Joey has a tray full of keys, and is trying each one in the lock.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nope, not that one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Can you go any faster with that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I got one keyhole and about a zillion keys. You do the math.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why do you guys have so many keys in there anyway?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: For an emergency just like this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, listen, smirky. If it wasn’t for you and your stupid balloon, I would be on a plane watching a woman do this (makes a gesture like a stewardess pointing out exits) right now. But I’m not.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I swear you said you had the keys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, I didn’t. I wouldn’t say I had the keys unless I had the keys, and I obviously didn’t have the keys.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, ok, that’s it. Enough with the keys. No one say keys.
(Short pause.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would I have the keys?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Aside from the fact that you said you had them?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But I didn’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, you should have.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Because!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? Because everything is my responsibility? Isn’t it enough that I’m making Thanksgiving dinner for everyone? You know, everyone wants a different kind of potatoes, so I’m making different kinds of potatoes. Does anybody care what kind of potatoes I want? Nooooo, no, no! (starting to cry) Just as long as Phoebe gets her peas and onions, and Mario gets his tots, and it’s my first Thanksgiving, and it’s all burned, and, and I… I…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, Monica, only dogs can hear you now, so, look, the door’s open. Here we go.
(They walk in. Smoke fills the apartment.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, the turkey’s burnt. (checking pots) Potatoes are ruined, potatoes are ruined, potatoes are ruined.
(Ross enters, singing.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Here we come, walkin’ down the—this doesn’t smell like Mom’s.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it doesn’t, does it? But you wanted lumps, Ross? (picks up the pan of badly burnt potatoes) Well, here you go, buddy, ya got one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, god, this is great! The plane is gone, so it looks like I’m stuck here with you guys.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, we all had better plans. This was nobody’s first choice.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, really? So why was I busting my ass to make this delicious Thanksgiving dinner?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You call that delicious?
(all shouting)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Stop it, stop it, stop it!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Now this feels like Thanksgiving.
[Time lapse. Everyone is upset with each other. Phoebe is at the window.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ugly Naked Guy’s taking his turkey out of the oven. Oh my god. He’s not alone. Ugly Naked Guy’s having Thanksgiving dinner with Ugly Naked Gal.
(They all run to the window.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’ve gotta see this. All right Ugly Naked Guy!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ooh, Ugly Naked Dancing!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s nice that he has someone.
[Time lapse. The gang is around the table, eating grilled cheese sandwiches.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Shall I carve?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: By all means.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ok, who wants light cheese, and who wants dark cheese?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t even wanna know about the dark cheese.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Does anybody wanna split this with me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, I will.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, you guys have to make a wish.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Make a wish?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, you know, Thanksgiving. Ooh, you got the bigger half. What’d you wish for?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The bigger half.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’d like to propose a toast. Little toast here, ding ding. I know this isn’t the kind of Thanksgiving that all of you all planned, but for me, this has been really great, you know, I think because it didn’t involve divorce or projectile vomiting. Anyway, I was just thinking, I mean, if you’d gone to Vail, and if you guys’d been with your family, if you didn’t have syphilis and stuff, we wouldn’t be all together, you know? So I guess what I’m trying to say is that I’m very thankful that all of your Thanksgivings sucked.

content.speaker: All
content.text: That’s so sweet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And hey, here’s to a lousy Christmas.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And a crappy New Year.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here, here!

content.description: The Subway, Joey sees his poster and he peels off the caption on his poster, revealing more posters underneath. The captions read, as follows:

content.text: He’s finally happy with that and walks away.]
